June 15, 2022 at 9:05 a.m.)
JARED ISAACMAN, having been first duly sworn,
was examined and testified as follows:
DIRECT EXAMINATION
BY MR. WEIMER:
Q. Good morning, Mr. Isaacman. My name is
Ryan Weimer. I represent Card Connect in this case.
I’m going to ask you some questions today.
If at any time you don’t
understand the question, please have me rephrase
it.
A. Sounds good.
MR. WEIMER: We can go ahead and mark the
first exhibit, please.
(Plaintiff’s Electronic Exhibit 1/3/20
Email Thread marked for identification.)
BY MR. WEIMER:
Q. I’m putting up on the screen -- do you see
Exhibit 1?
Page 7
A. Yes.
Q. This is an email chain from January 3rd,
2020; correct?
A. Yes.
Q. And you’re on this email?
A. Yes.
Q. And this is with Mike Ressa; correct?
A. Yes.
Q. At this point in time, you understood that
Mr. Ressa was an executive at Fiserv; correct?
A. I knew he was an executive at Card Connect.
I don’t know at what point in time Card Connect
became Fiserv.
Q. Did you know whether Card Connect was
acquired by Fiserv or First Data?
A. I mean, I -- at some point knew that. I
don’t recall if it was after the acquisition of
First Data by Fiserv that it was all kind of rolled
up, but I knew -- I knew at some point there was
First Data, Fiserv, Card Connect. I don’t -- like
which of those brands swallowed up another at
various stages, I really -- I can’t tell you.
Q. You testified earlier in your deposition
that you had a call in January of 2020 with
Mr. Ressa. Do you recall that testimony?

Page 8
A. Yes.
Q. This is the email chain discussing that
call?
A. It looks like it, you know.
Q. And on the first page, you say --
MR. VANCE: Objection to form.
BY MR. WEIMER:
Q. -- "I’m happy to do so 8:00 a.m. to
4:00 p.m. any day next week. Thanks."
What call are you referring to there?
A. So there -- there was a couple of things
going on at this point. The -- there was an
invitation to Fiserv’s, you know, client summit
that was -- that I had been extended an invite to.
And I said, you know, "I can’t go, but I’m
happy to," you know, "make an appearance by video
or phone." So I -- I’d have to associate it that
way, yeah.
MR. WEIMER: Can we mark the next
exhibit, please.
(Plaintiff’s Exhibit 306 marked for
identification.)
BY MR. WEIMER:
Q. Mr. Isaacman, I put on the screen what’s
been marked as Exhibit 306. This is an email from

Page 9
January 10th, 2020. Do you see that?
A. Yes.
Q. And you’re on the email, again, with
Mr. Ressa; correct?
A. Yes.
Q. And in this email, Mr. Ressa says, "Shift4
is planning to announce the acquisition of
Merchant-Link tomorrow at the close of business."
Do you see that?
A. Yes.
Q. And you respond, "Got it."
A. Yes.
Q. And Mr. Ressa says, "I just didn’t want you
to be surprised."
A. Yes.
Q. And you write, "I might be.
A. Yes.
Q. And you say, "Merchant-Link isn’t a
priority for us. We were more interested in the
restaurant tech"?
A. Yes.
Q. Did you mean what you said here, that, "I
might be"?
MR. VANCE: Objection to form.
